info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 10:59PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CADDO PARISH... MARION...SOUTHERN CASS AND NORTHEASTERN HARRISON COUNTIES THROUGH 1130 PM CDT... At 1059 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Hughes Springs to near Smithland. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Jefferson, Linden, Hughes Springs, Bivins, Karnack, Lodi, Smithland, Berea, Kildare, Gray, Fairview, Avinger, Uncertain, Lassater, and Pruett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
